articles.author: Josh Smith, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: A defiant South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces a second impeachment vote on Saturday over his short-lived attempt to impose martial law, a move that shocked the country, split his party and imperilled his presidency half way through his term.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon faces second impeachment vote over martial law bid

articles.author: Erin Banco, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: In the early days of 2013, an American man, dressed in ragged clothing, dodged between houses in the streets of Damascus’ upscale Mazzeh neighborhood looking for a civilian to take him to safety after more than five months of captivity in the concrete cells of a local prison.
articles.title: Austin Tice: a clue from 2013 in search for US reporter missing in Syria

articles.author: Bulent Usta, Tuvan Gumrukcu
articles.description: Thousands gathered in northwestern Syria on Friday for weekly prayers and a rally where clerics in the port city of Latakia, a former stronghold of ousted President Bashar al-Assad, urged national unity under the country's new government.
articles.title: Syrian clerics in former Assad stronghold call for national unity, democracy

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Huseyin Hayatsever
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan agreed on Friday on the need for continued efforts to counter any resurgence of Islamic State in Syria following the fall of Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Blinken, in Turkey, discusses Islamic State in Syria, Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Tom Polansek
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture late on Friday walked back comments that it could resume imports of Mexican cattle before year-end holidays, after it suspended shipments last month due to the discovery of New World screwworm in Mexico.
articles.title: USDA does not expect to resume Mexico cattle imports before holidays, chief veterinary officer says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia appears to be packing up military equipment at a military air base in Syria, according to satellite images released by Maxar following rebels' overthrow of President Bashar al-Assad last weekend.
articles.title: Russia packing up military equipment at base in Syria, satellite images show

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon, Sudip Kar-Gupta
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron named Francois Bayrou as his fourth prime minister of 2024 on Friday, charging the veteran centrist with steering the country out of its second political crisis in the past six months.
articles.title: France's Macron names veteran centrist ally Bayrou as prime minister

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Umit Bektas
articles.description: Syrian cyclist Bassel Soufi rode his bike 40 km (25 miles) from the northwestern city of Latakia on Friday to visit the Assad family's private coastal resort as local residents strolled around the compound for the first time in decades.
articles.title: Syrians explore Assad family's massive summer resort for first time

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italy's government has granted citizenship to Argentina's President Javier Milei on account of his Italian family roots, a source with knowledge of the matter said on Friday, confirming earlier media reports.
articles.title: Argentina's Milei given Italian citizenship during Rome visit, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping will visit Macau from Dec. 18 to 20 to attend the inauguration ceremony of Macau's new government, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Saturday.
articles.title: China's Xi will visit Macau Dec 18-20
